definitions: To enter a place by walking.
To accidentally hit something or someone while walking.
To get into a difficult or unpleasant situation, often without intending to.
To obtain something easily or unexpectedly.
examples: She walked into the room and sat down.
He wasn't looking where he was going and walked into a lamppost.
They walked into a trap set by their rivals.
He walked into a great job right after college.
